meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dilatant.
meanings.sent1: The dilatancies of the clay caused it to expand when pressure was applied.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the dilatancies of the soil to understand its behavior under stress.
meanings.sent3: The dilatancies of the rubber band made it stretch further than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement created a dilatancies in her heart, making it feel like it would burst with joy.
meanings.sent5: The dilatancies of the balloon were evident as it grew larger and larger with each breath.

meanings.definition: The property of a material that increases in volume when subjected to shear stress.
meanings.sent1: The dilatancies of the sponge were evident when it expanded in water.
meanings.sent2: Engineers consider the dilatancies of concrete when designing structures to prevent cracking.
meanings.sent3: The dilatancies of the marshmallow made it puff up when roasted over the fire.
meanings.sent4: The dilatancies of the hot air balloon allowed it to rise gracefully into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The dilatancies of the dough caused it to rise beautifully in the oven.
